channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: Washington Post Breached by Clop Ransomware via Oracle Flaws
item.description:
The Washington Post has officially confirmed it was a victim of a large-scale cyberattack orchestrated by the Clop ransomware group. The threat actors exploited vulnerabilities in Oracle's E-Business Suite, compromising over 100 organizations globally. The campaign involves data exfiltration followe...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Microsoft 'Whisper Leak' Attack Can Spy on Encrypted AI Chats
item.description:
Microsoft researchers have discovered a novel side-channel attack method named 'Whisper Leak' that undermines the privacy of encrypted AI chatbot conversations. By analyzing the size and timing of encrypted data packets from streaming Large Language Models (LLMs), a passive network observer can accu...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Intelligence, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Chinese-Made Electric Buses in Europe & Australia Pose Remote Shutdown Risk
item.description:
Cybersecurity tests conducted in Norway on November 7, 2025, have uncovered a significant security risk in Chinese-manufactured Yutong electric buses, which are widely used across Europe and Australia. The 'Lion Cage' experiment demonstrated that the buses' connected systems could theoretically be a...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Philippines Lawmakers Push for National Cybersecurity Fund
item.description:
In the Philippines, Representatives Migz and Luigi Villafuerte have introduced a proposal to create a 'Cybersecurity Risk Management and Mitigation Fund' (CRMMF). This dedicated national fund would provide the government with the necessary resources to prevent and respond to cyberattacks against bot...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical Container Escape Flaws in runC Threaten Docker & Kubernetes
item.description:
A security alert issued on November 9, 2025, warns of three new critical vulnerabilities in runC, the low-level container runtime used by Docker, Kubernetes, and other major container platforms. The flaws could allow a malicious actor to execute a 'container escape,' breaking out of the isolated con...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Malicious VS Code Extension with Ransomware Capabilities Discovered on Official Marketplace
item.description:
A malicious Visual Studio (VS) Code extension named "susvsex" was discovered on the official VS Code Extension Marketplace. The extension, which appears to have been created with AI assistance, contained overt ransomware capabilities. Upon activation, it was designed to archive a target directory, e...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Supply Chain Attack, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Data of Nearly 200,000 Supporters of Hungarian Party TISZA Leaked Online
item.description:
The personal data of nearly 200,000 supporters of the Hungarian political party TISZA has been leaked and is being widely distributed online. The breach, which occurred in October 2025, originated from the party's "TISZA Világ" service. The compromised dataset, containing 198,500 records, has been a...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Bahrain Fosters Digital Talent with AI and Cybersecurity Partnership
item.description:
Bahrain is strengthening its national digital capabilities through a new partnership between Beyon Cyber, a cybersecurity firm, and Bahrain Polytechnic. The two organizations signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to foster innovation in Artificial Intelligence and cybersecurity. The collaborati...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Other

Read Full Article →

item.title: Massive 'I Paid Twice' Phishing Scheme Defrauds Booking.com Hotels and Guests
item.description:
A sophisticated global phishing campaign named 'I Paid Twice' is targeting hotels on Booking.com and Expedia, compromising their administrative accounts to defraud guests. Since at least April 2025, attackers have been using social engineering and the PureRAT malware to gain access to hotel systems....

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Samsung Zero-Day Exploited in the Wild to Install 'LANDFALL' Android Spyware
item.description:
A now-patched zero-day vulnerability, CVE-2025-21042, in Samsung Galaxy devices was actively exploited to install a commercial-grade Android spyware known as LANDFALL. Researchers from Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 discovered that attackers sent malicious DNG image files via WhatsApp to targets in the...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Malware, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: State-Backed Hacking Escalates: Russia Targets Ukraine, China Eyes Latin America
item.description:
A new report from ESET reveals a significant escalation in cyber operations by state-sponsored threat groups from Russia and China between April and September 2025. Russia-aligned groups, notably Sandworm, have accelerated destructive wiper malware attacks against Ukraine's critical infrastructure, ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Patient Sabotage: Malicious NuGet Packages with Time-Delayed ICS Payloads Discovered
item.description:
Security researchers have discovered nine malicious packages on the NuGet repository, downloaded over 9,400 times, containing hidden, time-delayed sabotage code. One package, 'Sharp7Extend,' was specifically designed to corrupt write operations in industrial control systems (ICS) by silently causing...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Industrial Control Systems, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Software Supply Chain Attacks Skyrocket to Record High, Driven by Ransomware Gangs
item.description:
Software supply chain attacks reached an all-time high in October 2025, with 41 claimed incidents, according to a new report from Cyble. This figure is over 30% higher than the previous monthly record. Ransomware groups, particularly Qilin and Akira, are identified as the primary drivers of this tre...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Ransomware, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Amazon Patches High-Severity Flaw in WorkSpaces Linux Client
item.description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) has patched a high-severity vulnerability, CVE-2025-12779, in its WorkSpaces client for Linux. The flaw, rated 8.8 CVSS, could allow a local attacker on a shared computer to extract another user's authentication token and gain unauthorized access to their virtual desktop se...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: U.S. Congressional Budget Office Breached by Suspected Foreign Actor
item.description:
The U.S. Congressional Budget Office (CBO), the nonpartisan agency that provides economic analysis to Congress, confirmed on November 6, 2025, that it suffered a significant cybersecurity breach. The attack is suspected to be the work of a foreign government, raising concerns about espionage and the...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cisco Warns of New DoS Attacks Actively Exploiting Firewall Flaws
item.description:
Cisco has issued an urgent warning about a new attack variant actively targeting its Secure Firewall products. Threat actors are chaining two previously disclosed vulnerabilities, CVE-2025-20333 and CVE-2025-20362, to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition on unpatched Adaptive Security Appliance...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical SQL Injection Flaw in Django Framework Puts Web Apps at Risk
item.description:
The Django project has released urgent security updates to patch a critical SQL injection vulnerability, CVE-2025-64459, rated 9.1 on the CVSS scale. The flaw affects Django versions 4.2, 5.1, 5.2, and the 6.0 beta. It allows an attacker to manipulate database queries by passing a specially crafted ...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Washington Post Confirms Breach in Cl0p's Oracle Supply Chain Attack
item.description:
The Washington Post confirmed on November 6, 2025, that it was a victim of the widespread supply chain attack orchestrated by the Cl0p ransomware gang. The attack exploited a zero-day vulnerability in Oracle's E-Business Suite (EBS), a widely used enterprise software platform. This confirmation came...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Ransomware, Data Breach

item.title: Zscaler: 239 Malicious Apps on Google Play Downloaded 42 Million Times
item.description:
A new report from Zscaler's ThreatLabz, published November 5, 2025, reveals a dramatic 67% year-over-year increase in Android malware. Researchers identified 239 malicious applications that successfully bypassed Google Play Store security, amassing a collective 42 million downloads before being remo...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Malware, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Hackers Hijack Logistics Systems to Orchestrate Physical Cargo Heists
item.description:
A new and growing form of hybrid crime is targeting the supply chain, where cybercriminals infiltrate freight and logistics companies to facilitate physical cargo theft. According to recent reports, threat actors compromise carrier systems, often using legitimate Remote Monitoring and Management (RM...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Intelligence
